messages.content: The outcome of the next general election will be crucial for all of us in Erith & Thamesmead.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour has acted to keep people in their homes with schemes to help the most vulnerable.
The Conservative record in Bexley has seen a rise in council tax by 9% and cuts to services like cancellation of weekly refuse collection, axed Meals on Wheels and hiked parking charges by 300%.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's your vote and it's your choice on May 6.

issues.economy: Clearly the recession has been tough. But the action Labour has taken has made a difference. As a result repossessions are running at half the rate of the last Conservative recession, when families were left to sink or swim.
issues.governance: Just examine the Conservative record in Bexley. You pay more and get less.

housing.content: Labour has acted to keep people in their homes with schemes to help the most vulnerable. As a result repossessions are running at half the rate of the last Conservative recession, when families were left to sink or swim.

leaflet.personalStatement: I've enclosed a postal vote form.

quotes.text: Clearly the recession has been tough. But the action Labour has taken has made a difference.

images.caption: Teresa Pearce - a strong local voice for Erith & Thamesmead

leaflet.additionalNotes: PS - If you have any questions about postal voting, or any other issue, just get in touch! Either send me an email or call my office on 01322 351991.
